meanings.definition: A person who removes their clothing as part of a performance.
meanings.sent1: The strippers at the club danced gracefully on stage.
meanings.sent2: I went to a party where strippers were hired to entertain the guests.
meanings.sent3: The strippers at the circus made the audience laugh with their funny costumes.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was like that of a strippers, shedding layers to reveal her true self.
meanings.sent5: The image of the strippers' colorful costumes stayed in my mind long after the show.

meanings.definition: Tools used to remove insulation from wires.
meanings.sent1: My dad used strippers to fix the electrical wiring in our house.
meanings.sent2: The electrician carried a set of strippers in his toolbox.
meanings.sent3: The strippers in the garage helped in making the wires safe to touch.
meanings.sent4: The strippers' sharp blades cut through the wire's insulation like a hot knife through butter.
meanings.sent5: Using the strippers, he carefully exposed the copper wire underneath.

meanings.sent1: The strippers were used to take off the old paint from the walls.
meanings.sent2: I bought a can of strippers to help with the renovation project.
meanings.sent3: The strippers smelled strong, but they did the job well.
meanings.sent4: The strippers dissolved the paint as if it was never there.
meanings.sent5: After applying the strippers, the paint peeled off easily.
